description: Replacement of lantern light to north facing side elevation; replacement of chimney to side elevation; replacement of boundary walls; installation of one air conditioning unit to north side elevation; installation of a cycle store within the rear garden; replacement of one window to rear elevation at ground floor level; replacement of two windows to rear elevation at second floor level; installation of new window to side elevation at ground floor level (Retrospective)
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents:
Site Location Plan
Existing Ground Floor and Site Plan A714 Dwg. PM01
Existing First Floor, Second Floor and Loft Plans A714 Dwg. PM02
Existing Front and Side Elevations A714 Dwg. PM03
Existing Side and Rear Elevations A714 Dwg. PM04
Existing Street Elevations A714 Dwg. PM05
Previously Approved: Proposed Ground Floor and Site Plan A690 Dwg. PL01
Proposed Ground Floor and Site Plan A714 Dwg. PL01
Proposed First Floor, Second Floor and Loft Plans A714 Dwg. PL02 rev A
Proposed Front and Side Elevations A714 Dwg. PL03
Proposed Side and Rear Elevation A714 Dwg. PL04
Proposed Street Elevations Dwg. A714 PL05
Joinery Details with Single Glazing A714 Dwg. PL20 rev A
Bicycle Store G11.2 Details A714 Dwg. PL21
Boundary Wall Details A714 Dwg. PL22
A714 - Photograph Sheets
Fire Safety Site Plan A714 Dwg. F01
Heritage Statement dated December 2021
3D Rendering A714 Dwg. 3D1
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Within 6 months of the date of this permission, details of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/ machinery/ equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, including reflected and re-radiated noise, together with mitigation measures as appropriate shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing.  The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity. Where required, a post installation sound assessment shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The assessment shall be carried out to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and shall include additional steps to mitigate noise as necessary.
Approved details shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Within 6 months of the date of this permission, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 & D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
